data.scheme_name: Integrated and Sustainable Textile Policy 2023-28 - Textile Parks - Existing
data.benefits: Scheme provides assistance up to 49% of Fixed Capital Investment subject to maximum up to Rs 4900 lakhs.
data.eligibility: All textile parks are eligible under the scheme.
data.conditions:
1. Fixed Capital Investment (FCI) will not include the cost of land and building construction. 
  2. The Project must generate 10% more employment than the existing project. 
  3. The detailed project report (DPR) of the new textile unit will include the cost of setting up the solar power plant up to a maximum limit of 4 MW.
data.beneficiaries: All textile parks are eligible under the scheme.
data.prerequisites:
1. Fixed Capital Investment (FCI) will not include the cost of land and building construction. 
  2. The Project must generate 10% more employment than the existing project. 
  3. The detailed project report (DPR) of the new textile unit will include the cost of setting up the solar power plant up to a maximum limit of 4 MW.
data.context:
• Integrated and Sustainable Textile Policy of the State is in line with the 5F vision of the Government of India- Farm to Fiber to Factory to Fashion to Foreign. 
  • The policy envisions integrating the whole textile value chain and create an enabling environment for sustained growth of all sub-sectors in the industry.
data.objective: The objective of this scheme is to strengthen the sector and encourage units in various parts of the State.
data.description:
1. Government of India provides financial assistance at Rs 4000 lakhs or 40% of the FCI whichever is less. 
  2. In proportion to this, the State Government provides financial assistance at Rs 900 lakhs or 9% of the FCI whichever is less.
data.how_to_apply: The applicant can apply through the Maharashtra Textile Department : https://etextile.maharashtra.gov.in/registration
data.funding_mechanism:
1. The capital subsidy will be paid after the project comes into production. 
  2. This will be paid in two installments: 
    • 1st instalment: 60% of eligible amount after 12 months. 
    • 2nd instalment: 40% of eligible amount after 24 months.
data.additional_info:
• Zone 1: - Amravati, Akola, Amravati, Buldhana, Bhandara, Chandrapur, Gadchiroli, Gondia, Nagpur, Washim, Wardha, Yavatmal. 
  • Zone 2: - Aurangabad, Beed, Dhule, Hingoli, Jalgaon, Jalna, Latur, Nanded, Osmanabad, Parbhani. 
  • Zone 3: - Ahmednagar, Nashik, Nandurbar. 
  • Zone 4: - Kolhapur, Mumbai City, Mumbai Suburban, Palaghar, Pune, Ratnagiri, Raigad, Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara, Solapur, Thane. 
  • Any existing project increasing its fixed capital investment by 25% and increasing its total production capacity by 25% as compared to the previous year. 
  • The Project must generate 10% more employment than the existing project. Such expansion will include forward and backward integration.
data.checklist_info_a:
1. Udyam Registration Certificate 
2. GST Certificate 
3. Financials for Last 2 years 
4. Projected financial data 
5. Lending Bank Details 
6. Basic KYC Documents
data.checklist_info_d: Government of Maharashtra, Co-operation, Marketing and Textile Department, Mantralaya, Mumbai 400032
data.beneficiary: Manufacturing textile industry - All Entities - Maharashtra - All MSMEs and Non MSMEs
data.lifecycle: Required Credit Support for Scale - Up
